{{also|doktor}} ==German== {{wikipedia|lang=de}} ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|Doctor}} {{qualifier|dated}} * {{l|de|Dr.}} {{qualifier|abbreviation}} ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{etyl|la|de}} {{m|la|doctor}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈdɔktoːɐ̯/|/-tɔɐ̯/}} {{qualifier|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈdɔktɐ/}} {{qualifier|colloquial variant}} * {{audio|de|De-Doktor.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Doktors|Doktoren|pl2=Doktores}} # {{lb|de|academia}} [[doctor]] # {{lb|de|medicine, colloquial}} [[doctor]] ====Usage notes==== * The word ''Doktor'' is understood to mean "medical doctor" if the context hints at that, e.g. ''Du musst mal zum Doktor gehen'' – "You have to see a doctor". Unlike in English, however, this is not the case if the context is more general: ''Mein Vater ist Doktor'' – "My father has a PhD/doctorate". The common word for "medical doctor" is {{m|de|Arzt}}. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|s|en}} ====Derived terms==== {{rel-top|Terms derived from ''Doktor''}} * {{l|de|Berufsdoktor}} * {{l|de|der
